name: 1.1 - The current revision drawings are being used including subcontractors copy.
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the subcontractors copy. Current Revision to be obtained via Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - At least seven (7) working days prior to the delivery of the Class 1 Crushed Rock the Contractor is to provide the following for review and approval;
○ Once approval has been received the Contractor is to obtain one reference sample weighing 50kg and which is to be kept on site.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.4.1.2 & Cl.6.4.1.3
Acceptance Criteria - Supply information with respect to production testing, to requirements in VicRoads Section 812.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.6.1 & VicRoads section 812
Record of conformity - Approved production testing results
Responsibility - Project Engineer, Principal’s Design Representative
1.4 - Implementation of all measures and controls.
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented including: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS and WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Acceptance Criteria - The crushed rock base course is to be placed in 2 equal layers. The Contractor shall supply survey reports prior to the placement of prime coat or primerseal.
• The levels must be checked in a 5m square grid on the finished surface level and shall not deviate more than +0,10mm.
• The levels shall be recorded in a .TXT format with the relevant points displayed in a PDF file.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.5.2.1 & Cl.6.5.2.5
Record of conformity - Survey Report and Visual Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Proof rolling will occur upon the completion of compaction.
• The proof roll will be conducted in a systematic manner such that the entire area is covered uniformly.
• Only the top layer of the crushed rock basecourse is subject to proof rolling. Proof rolling to be undertaken with a multi wheel roller.
• The plant must travel at a speed no greater than 6km/hr.
• Contractor shall notify the Principal’s Design Consultant so that they are present for the entire duration of proof rolling.
• Proof rolling shall be undertaken with the pneumatic tyred roller or watercart.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.5.1.2.1
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Project Engineer, Principal’s Design Consultant
2.3 - Identification and treatment of unsuitable areas.

Acceptance Criteria - Should any area of crushed rock be disturbed or become unstable during proof rolling, the Principal’s Representative should be advised immediately and proof rolling of the area ceased.
• Any areas of crushed rock layer that rut, yield or become unstable under the proof rolling must be investigated in the presence of the Principal’s Representative.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.5.1.2.1
Responsibility - Project Engineer, Principals Design Representative
Acceptance Criteria - A Proof roll report must be submitted to the Contract Administrator and Principal’s Design Consultant for review.
• The hold point is released by the Contract Administrator or Principal’s Design Consultant after review and written approval of the proof rolling report.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.5.1.2.3
Inspection/ Test Method - Proof Roll Report
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of the compaction report shall be submitted to the Contract Administrator for review. The report is to include:
• Details of the Lot being tested
• Compliance or non-complaince of the lot
• Rectification actions and outcome in case of non-conforming compaction
○ When minimum field density testing frequency is 6 per lot or greater:
• Character dry density ratio ≥98% modified compaction
○ When minimum field density testing frequency is less than 6 per lot:
• Average dry density ratio ≥98% modified compaction
• More than 3000 m2 Minimum of one (1) test per 500 m2 or part thereof
○ Hold point released after review and written confirmation of the compaction report being received.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.6.2.5
Record of conformity - Compaction Testing Report & This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of the smoothness testing report is to be submitted to the contractor within seven (7) days of completion of the crushed rock lot.
• Surface smoothness shall be undertaken using 3.5m straight edge that is either hand held or mobile.
○ The straight edge shall be operated along:

• A set of parallel lines not more than 10m apart covering the whole surface and on another set of parallel lines not more than 10m apart that are perpendicular to the first set. The surface of the crushed rock basecourse shall not deviate from the 3.5m long straight edge by more than 7mm, except in directions of where a grade change occurs.
Reference Documents - AECOM MAPMP2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl.6.5.2.2
Record of conformity - Straight Edge Report & This signed ITP
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality \System Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
